name: vscode-legacy-csproj
description: Automatically keeps legacy csproj files up to date as you add and remove files from your project.

legacy-csproj.visual-studio-compat-addit.title: Additional XML Transforms for Visual Studio compatibility
legacy-csproj.visual-studio-compat-addit.description: Apply additional transformations to the csproj xml to make it consistent with Visual Studio's csproj files. This is important when other developers are using Visual Studio to prevent the file from flip flopping

legacy-csproj.line-ending.title: Line ending
legacy-csproj.line-ending.markdownDescription: The line ending to use when updating csproj files.
enumDescriptions: Use the line endings of your OS

legacy-csproj.empty-tag-expansion.title: Empty Tags To Expand
legacy-csproj.empty-tag-expansion.description: A list of tags that should be expanded to include a closing tag when empty. For some reason Visual Studio keeps expanding certain tags. Set this up as your project needs so that the csproj file doesn't flip flop between the two formats.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
